intro: Hieracium murorum subsp. sparsum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and basal rosettes of lanceolate leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a dense, flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the Compositae family. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and wastelands. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct morphological and genetic traits compared to other members of the Hieracium genus.
